alert.note: Alert for Baker; Coastal Duval; Inland Nassau; Northern Columbia; South Central Duval; Southern Columbia; Trout River; Western Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 4:58PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nassau, central Baker, northeastern Columbia, central Duval and southeastern Charlton Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 458 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Macclenny, or 22 miles southwest of Callahan, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph, half inch hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Callahan, Jacksonville International Arpt, Taylor, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Cisco Gardens, St. George, Bryceville, Nassau Village-Ratliff and Ratliff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
